summary: I now really wish they'd give us a season 4 (or dare I say 5) episode where once both Cyrus and TJ are out, that there is a...
question: I now really wish they'd give us a season 4 (or dare I say 5) episode where once both Cyrus and TJ are out, that there is a Pride festival subplot like Cyrus wanting to go but nervous that TJ still isn't comfortable about being so publicly open about being gay which makes him sad, but then TJ surprises him by saying he's actually been looking forward to going and is in a special outfit (that just so happens to look like Luke's rainbow ball outfit). They both go and are just both so happy.
answer: Absndnjfkfntnt TJ and Cyrus at a pride event would be so iconic. And really any episode featuring them doing gay stuff that isn’t inherently romantic. Like starting the school’s first GSA, or helping eachother come out to their parents, or anything of that nature. A season four is unlikely, and these two doing anything like this for season four is even more unlikely, but I love imagining TJ and Cyrus embracing their identities and living their best gay lives as a functional, drama free couple.

summary: first day on set - asher angel imagine
body:
first day on set - asher angel imagine

- so after months of auditioning for various roles, you finally landed one on Andi Mack

- you were super excited

- even more ecstatic when you remembered that Asher was on the show as Jonah

- when you arrived, butterflies filled your stomach

- but the cast was super welcoming!!

- joshua, sofia and peyton raced towards you

- asher was behind them and said, “geez guys don’t scare them haha”

- you immediately started blushing after seeing asher in person for the first time

- btw let’s pretend in all these imagines that asher is single lol (sorry no offense to ashannie okay this is just fiction)

- ANYWAYS asher is just as cool as you expected him to be

- he was the first one to knock on your trailer

- he came in with a bag of chips for you

- “y/n, i’m so excited you’re here with us. i promise it’ll be a fun time. welcome to our family!”

- you both hug

- and of course take a cute selfie together

- asher posts the picture of you two guys later on instagram with the caption, “Welcome y/n to the Andi Mack family! Can’t wait to start filming with you”

-

(REQUESTS ARE OPEN BTW! SEND ME ANY YOU HAVE BUT NOTHING INAPPORIATE SINCE ASHER IS ONLY 16)

blog.name: tyrusficsblog
blog.title: TyrusFics
blog.description: Just a boy that fell in love with the friendship of TJ and Cyrus from #AndiMack hoping that maybe they can be more. Send fic ideas?

body:
Confessions to a Stranger

(A Tyrus oneshot)

Confessions to a Stranger.. (A Tyrus Fic.) (1023 words) inspired by @reasonstolovebex

T.J. blindly walked through the streets of Shadyside trying to get home from school following Costume Day. He couldn’t bring himself to care that Kira was following him. He still was wearing that shirt that had “DRIBBLE” scribbled in black marker across the front. All he could think about was the look on Cyrus’ face. It burned. And he badly wanted to ball up and cry. He couldn’t believe himself.

“Excuse Me.” Kira shouted, trying to catch T.Js attention, to which he simply ignored trudging along.

“Stop following me.” He gritted through his teeth. Strained. “What do you want from me?”

Kira pauses in her footsteps as T.J looked back, quickly before colliding with someone, both falling to the ground.

Kira laughed smugly.

“Serves you right.” As she turned on her heels and stormed off.

T.J quickly gathered himself up, and help the fellow young woman up off the ground.

“I’m sorry.” T.J apologized. “ I wasn’t looking where I was going. Someone was following me.

“It’s fine. I was pretty much in my own headspace myself,” she held out her hand, and T.J shook it gently.

“T.J.” he answered her unspoken question.

“As in T.J Kippen.” She questioned curiously.

“How do you know me?” He questioned her.

“I don’t simply know you, I know of you. Tough bad boy. A bully.”

T.J cowers within himself. He knew what people thought of him, it just felt worse coming from a complete stranger.

“And you are?” He asked her.

“Bex Mack.”

Then everything clicked.

“That makes much more sense.” He laughed slightly.

She quirks at him.

“What do you mean?”

“Mother of Andi, whose best friends are Cyrus, and Driscoll, my former enemy. We’re kind of cool these days.” He paused, thinking back to earlier. “Well maybe not.” As he looked down at the shirt he had on. He hated it.

“Are you okay.” Bex asked him.

“I just, may have ruined our friendship. I hurt Cyrus.” He admitted.

“Well you seem pretty bummed about it, so it must not have been intentional.” She mused. “Is that why that girl was following you?”

“Part of it.” T.J couldn’t think of why he was opening up to a complete stranger he never met. Sure he met her daughter and her best friends but he felt that maybe she could help. Maybe.

“Well today was costume day.” He started.

“I’m aware. Andi, Cyrus, Buffy, and Jonah were supposed to be Mount Rushmore.”

That didn’t turn out as planned, T.J. thought to himself. Before he left he saw a not too happy Andi, a miserable looking Cyrus, Buffy, and that kid. Certainly not Jonah. He thought back to Cyrus face and teared up slightly.

“Well, I suggested to Cyrus that we do a different costume, a costume that was an inside joke that only we knew about.” T.J smiled.

“What was the costume?” Bex asked him curiously.

“Somersault.”

“Somersault?”

“Well Cyrus has a list of things that he doesn’t know how to do.”

Bex laughed slightly.

“Sounds like Cyrus. The kid has no faith in himself.” She laughed, slightly shaking her head.

“Tell me about it.” He smiled. “Anyway he told me he couldn’t do a somersault and I taught him how to do one. I even have the video.” He frantically searched his gallery pulling up the video of them at the gym and the kids cheering Cyrus on.

Bex couldn’t help but cheer for Cyrus herself, before looking back to T.J.

“You seem very fond of him. How did you hurt him?”

T.J. simply gestured to his costume he had on.

“I bailed on him. On a costume I suggested. He was so excited about it too. It meant as much to him as it did to me, that’s how I know I hurt him. If you could have seen his face, Bex. He was so crushed. I feel terrible.” T.Js emotions bubbled over, and tears were now visibly streaming down his face.

Bex reached out to him.

“But why? It doesn’t make any sense. Why would you do such a thing.”

“How would people look at it? What would people think of two boys wearing a costume that nobody understood the meaning to?”

Bex pondered this for a second as the answer hit her full force, and everything suddenly made sense.

“Did that girl that was following you make you feel this way?”

T.J. nodded slightly.

“She wanted to do this” he gestured toward the T-shirt. “She said if I’d rather to a costume with her than with Cyrus, and to be honest. I would. But the way she said it was” T. J paused thinking of the right word.

“Manipulative.”

T.J nodded slightly.

“Exactly. She made me feel like it was wrong. Like I was wrong.”

Bex brought T.Js face up to meet hers.

“Wrong about what?”

“For liking Cyrus. . I think she kind of figured it out when she brought up the costume idea, and I turned her down for Cyrus. Multiple times might I add.”

“So you like Cyrus?” Bex asked.

T.J. blushed profusely and nodded shyly.

“A lot actually. I’ve never felt this way about, well, anyone.”

“And how do you think Cyrus feels.”

T.J shrugged.

“He probably hates me now.”

“I wouldn’t say he hates you, just probably disappointed in you, but he doesn’t know why you did it. I think you need to talk to him. Things might work out for the better. And T.J. your feelings are valid. Don’t let anyone make you feel like you’re wrong just for having feelings. It’s okay.”

“Thanks Bex. I really needed that. But could you keep this conversation between us, I want to give myself a good head space before I talk with Cyrus. I plan on telling him how I feel, soon.” He berated himself.

“Well despite what anyone else has to say about you, I think you’re a good kid with a good head on his shoulders, just don’t let people rough you up to much, and you’ll be alright kid. And your secret is safe with me.” She nodded toward him.

reblog.comment:
Confessions to a Stranger

(A Tyrus oneshot)

Confessions to a Stranger.. (A Tyrus Fic.) (1023 words) inspired by @reasonstolovebex

T.J. blindly walked through the streets of Shadyside trying to get home from school following Costume Day. He couldn’t bring himself to care that Kira was following him. He still was wearing that shirt that had “DRIBBLE” scribbled in black marker across the front. All he could think about was the look on Cyrus’ face. It burned. And he badly wanted to ball up and cry. He couldn’t believe himself.

“Excuse Me.” Kira shouted, trying to catch T.Js attention, to which he simply ignored trudging along.

“Stop following me.” He gritted through his teeth. Strained. “What do you want from me?”

Kira pauses in her footsteps as T.J looked back, quickly before colliding with someone, both falling to the ground.

Kira laughed smugly.

“Serves you right.” As she turned on her heels and stormed off.

T.J quickly gathered himself up, and help the fellow young woman up off the ground.

“I’m sorry.” T.J apologized. “ I wasn’t looking where I was going. Someone was following me.

“It’s fine. I was pretty much in my own headspace myself,” she held out her hand, and T.J shook it gently.

“T.J.” he answered her unspoken question.

“As in T.J Kippen.” She questioned curiously.

“How do you know me?” He questioned her.

“I don’t simply know you, I know of you. Tough bad boy. A bully.”

T.J cowers within himself. He knew what people thought of him, it just felt worse coming from a complete stranger.

“And you are?” He asked her.

“Bex Mack.”

Then everything clicked.

“That makes much more sense.” He laughed slightly.

She quirks at him.

“What do you mean?”

“Mother of Andi, whose best friends are Cyrus, and Driscoll, my former enemy. We’re kind of cool these days.” He paused, thinking back to earlier. “Well maybe not.” As he looked down at the shirt he had on. He hated it.

“Are you okay.” Bex asked him.

“I just, may have ruined our friendship. I hurt Cyrus.” He admitted.

“Well you seem pretty bummed about it, so it must not have been intentional.” She mused. “Is that why that girl was following you?”

“Part of it.” T.J couldn’t think of why he was opening up to a complete stranger he never met. Sure he met her daughter and her best friends but he felt that maybe she could help. Maybe.

“Well today was costume day.” He started.

“I’m aware. Andi, Cyrus, Buffy, and Jonah were supposed to be Mount Rushmore.”

That didn’t turn out as planned, T.J. thought to himself. Before he left he saw a not too happy Andi, a miserable looking Cyrus, Buffy, and that kid. Certainly not Jonah. He thought back to Cyrus face and teared up slightly.

“Well, I suggested to Cyrus that we do a different costume, a costume that was an inside joke that only we knew about.” T.J smiled.

“What was the costume?” Bex asked him curiously.

“Somersault.”

“Somersault?”

“Well Cyrus has a list of things that he doesn’t know how to do.”

Bex laughed slightly.

“Sounds like Cyrus. The kid has no faith in himself.” She laughed, slightly shaking her head.

“Tell me about it.” He smiled. “Anyway he told me he couldn’t do a somersault and I taught him how to do one. I even have the video.” He frantically searched his gallery pulling up the video of them at the gym and the kids cheering Cyrus on.

Bex couldn’t help but cheer for Cyrus herself, before looking back to T.J.

“You seem very fond of him. How did you hurt him?”

T.J. simply gestured to his costume he had on.

“I bailed on him. On a costume I suggested. He was so excited about it too. It meant as much to him as it did to me, that’s how I know I hurt him. If you could have seen his face, Bex. He was so crushed. I feel terrible.” T.Js emotions bubbled over, and tears were now visibly streaming down his face.

Bex reached out to him.

“But why? It doesn’t make any sense. Why would you do such a thing.”

“How would people look at it? What would people think of two boys wearing a costume that nobody understood the meaning to?”

Bex pondered this for a second as the answer hit her full force, and everything suddenly made sense.

“Did that girl that was following you make you feel this way?”

T.J. nodded slightly.

“She wanted to do this” he gestured toward the T-shirt. “She said if I’d rather to a costume with her than with Cyrus, and to be honest. I would. But the way she said it was” T. J paused thinking of the right word.

“Manipulative.”

T.J nodded slightly.

“Exactly. She made me feel like it was wrong. Like I was wrong.”

Bex brought T.Js face up to meet hers.

“Wrong about what?”

“For liking Cyrus. . I think she kind of figured it out when she brought up the costume idea, and I turned her down for Cyrus. Multiple times might I add.”

“So you like Cyrus?” Bex asked.

T.J. blushed profusely and nodded shyly.

“A lot actually. I’ve never felt this way about, well, anyone.”

“And how do you think Cyrus feels.”

T.J shrugged.

“He probably hates me now.”

“I wouldn’t say he hates you, just probably disappointed in you, but he doesn’t know why you did it. I think you need to talk to him. Things might work out for the better. And T.J. your feelings are valid. Don’t let anyone make you feel like you’re wrong just for having feelings. It’s okay.”

“Thanks Bex. I really needed that. But could you keep this conversation between us, I want to give myself a good head space before I talk with Cyrus. I plan on telling him how I feel, soon.” He berated himself.

“Well despite what anyone else has to say about you, I think you’re a good kid with a good head on his shoulders, just don’t let people rough you up to much, and you’ll be alright kid. And your secret is safe with me.” She nodded toward him.
